com.tinfoil.sms.database

Class DBAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinfoil.sms.database.DBAccessor

  • public class DBAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a database that is read and write and provides methods to facilitate the reading and writing to the database. Table Names are all from SQLitehelper since they are created in that class.

      • getKeyExchangeMessage

        public Entry getKeyExchangeMessage(java.lang.String number)
        Get the pending key exchange message for the contact with the given number.
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the contact whose key exchange message is needed.
        Returns:
        The Entry in the key exchange db that contains the number and the key exchange message.

      • getAllKeyExchangeMessages

        public java.util.ArrayList<Entry> getAllKeyExchangeMessages()
        Get all of the pending key exchange messages.

      • getKeyExchangeMessageCount

        public int getKeyExchangeMessageCount()
        Get all of the pending key exchange messages.
        Returns:
        The number of key exchanges pending

      • addKeyExchangeMessage

        public java.lang.String addKeyExchangeMessage(Entry keyExchange)
        Add a pending key exchange message.
        Parameters:
        keyExchange - The pending key exchange message
        Returns:
        The error message, if null the addition was successful.

      • deleteKeyExchangeMessage

        public void deleteKeyExchangeMessage(java.lang.String number)
        Delete the pending key exchange message. Calling this method means the user has either rejected the key exchange or accepted.
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the contact who had a pending key exchange that has now been dealt with.

      • addNumbersRow

        private long addNumbersRow(long reference,
                 Number number)
        Add a row to the numbers table.
        Parameters:
        reference - The reference id of the contact the number belongs to.
        number - The Number that contains all the information to be stored.

      • addMessageRow

        private void addMessageRow(long reference,
                 Message message)
        TODO implement passive message deleter, (such that every time a message is added it will check if the message count is above the limit, if it is it will delete the oldest messages until it is under the limit Add a message to the database, only a limited number of messages are stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        reference - The id of the number that the message came from or was sent to.
        message - A message object containing all the information for the message.

      • deleteMessage

        public boolean deleteMessage(long id)
        Delete messages that are stored in the database
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the message in the database.
        Returns:
        Whether the message was deleted or not.

      • deleteMessage

        public boolean deleteMessage(java.lang.String number)
        Delete the messages that this number has stored in the database.
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the contact that is in the database.
        Returns:
        Whether the messages are deleted or not.

      • updateMessageCount

        public void updateMessageCount(java.lang.String number,
                      int unreadMessageCount)
        Updates the message count for the particular given number to the given new count.
        Parameters:
        number - A number from the contact.
        unreadMessageCount - The new number of unread messages.

      • addNewMessage

        public void addNewMessage(Message message,
                 java.lang.String number,
                 boolean unread)
        Add a new message to the database.
        Parameters:
        message - The Message that contains all the information to be stored.
        number - The number of the contact the message was sent to or received from.
        unread - Whether the message has been read or has not, true the message is unread, false otherwise.

      • getNumber

        public Number getNumber(java.lang.String number)
        Get a Number from the database given the number. This method is met to simplify transactions that require only the contact's Number and no other information. It is a less expensive query
        Parameters:
        number - The contact's number
        Returns:
        The Number containing all the relevant information about the contact's number

      • getRow

        public TrustedContact getRow(java.lang.String number)
        Retrieve the information relating to the contact who has the given number. This does not however retrieve the messages of each particular contact's number.
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the contact to retrieve
        Returns:
        The TrustedContact containing all the information in the database about that contact.

      • getAllRows

        public java.util.ArrayList<TrustedContact> getAllRows(int select)
        Get all of the rows in the database with the columns
        Parameters:
        select - Whether to get trusted, untrusted or all contacts.
        Returns:
        The list of all the contacts in the database with all relevant information about them.

      • removeRow

        public boolean removeRow(java.lang.String number)
        Deletes the rows with the given number
        Parameters:
        number - The primary number of the contact to be deleted
        Returns:
        True if the contacts were deleted properly, false otherwise.

      • isTrustedContact

        public boolean isTrustedContact(java.lang.String number)
        Checks if the given number is a trusted contact's number
        Parameters:
        number - The number of the potential trusted contact
        Returns:
        True if the contact is found in the database and is in the trusted state, false otherwise. A contact is in the trusted state if they have a key (!= null)

      • isTrustedContact

        public boolean isTrustedContact(TrustedContact tc)
        Parameters:
        tc - The contact to check for a trusted number
        Returns:
        True if the contact is trusted, false otherwise. (NOTE: see isTrustedContact(String number) for more details)

      • isNumberTrusted

        public boolean[] isNumberTrusted(java.util.ArrayList<Number> number)
        Parameters:
        contacts - The contact to check for a trusted number
        Returns:
        True if the contact is trusted, false otherwise. (NOTE: see isTrustedContact(String number) for more details)

      • addMessageToQueue

        public void addMessageToQueue(java.lang.String number,
                     java.lang.String message,
                     boolean keyExchange)
        Adding a message to the queue to be sent when there is service to send the message. Once the message has been sent it will be removed from the queue.
        Parameters:
        number - The number for the contact that the message will be sent to.
        message - The message that will be sent to the contact with the given number.

      • getFirstInQueue

        public Entry getFirstInQueue()
        Get the first element within the queue. *Note the entry is also removed from the queue.
        Returns:
        The first element in the queue stored in the database. If the queue is empty then the return is null.

      • deleteQueueEntry

        public void deleteQueueEntry(long id)
        Delete a given entry from the queue
        Parameters:
        id - The private key

      • deleteFirstQueueEntry

        public void deleteFirstQueueEntry()
        Delete the first entry in the queue
